definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to escape from the abyss of suffering/to shed off a wretched plight

sentences.english: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
sentences.chinese: 求你救我脱离作孽的人，和喜爱流人血的人。

sentences.english: Some of your red blood cells are deviating from this pattern.
sentences.chinese: 一些你的红色血球正在脱离这一个典型。

sentences.english: They want Beijing out of the World Trade Organization.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望中国脱离世界贸易组织。

sentences.english: I hope that these 17 tips will help you find a way out of grumpiness.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这17个办法可以帮助你脱离暴躁的情绪。

sentences.english: There, I've said it -- it feels so good to have that off my chest.
sentences.chinese: 在此，我已经说过能够脱离开书架让我感觉非常好。

sentences.english: What are some of your pain-avoiding and pleasure-inducing patterns?
sentences.chinese: 你有哪些让自己脱离痛苦和获得欢乐的方式？

sentences.english: I have already separated from the school days and stepped into the society.
sentences.chinese: 我已经脱离菁菁校园，正式步入社会。

sentences.english: An experimental study to investigate bubble detachment point in the sub-cooled boiling at low pressure and velocity is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 叙述了低压低流速下过冷沸腾汽泡脱离点的试验研究。

sentences.english: He sent forth his word and healed them, and rescued them from destruction.
sentences.chinese: 主发一言就将他们病除，且拯救他们脱离了阴府。

sentences.english: Wally was now out of danger and removed from intensive care.
sentences.chinese: 沃利已经脱离危险，不再需要精心护理。

sentences.english: Mexico achieved independence from Spain in 1821.
sentences.chinese: 1821年的今天，墨西哥脱离西班牙取得独立。

sentences.english: That is how people should overcome their left side, by putting their attention away from the dead things.
sentences.chinese: 这就是人们应当怎样让注意力脱离死物，以超越左脉。

sentences.english: His dreams are often divorced frow reality.
sentences.chinese: 他的梦想常常脱离现实。

sentences.english: The Party cannot live and develop if it isolates itself from the non-party masses.
sentences.chinese: 党脱离了非党群众就不能存在和发展。

sentences.english: In 1974 , Niue becomes independent from New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 1974年的今天，纽埃岛脱离新西兰独立。

sentences.english: Permanent cells have left the cell cycle and are destined to senesce and die.
sentences.chinese: 永久性细胞已脱离细胞周期，注定要衰老和死亡。

definition: to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to jump out/fig. to appear suddenly
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
to be far from/to keep away from
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to remove/to sack/to get rid of/to relieve (sb of their duties)/to free/to lift (an embargo)/to rescind (an agreement)
